title: 107_hr2501
content:
The "Appalachian Regional Development Reauthorization Act of 2001" makes amendments to the Appalachian Regional Development Act of 1965, focusing on the coordination of Appalachian regional development programs. The "Appalachian Regional Development Reauthorization Act of 2001" amends the Appalachian Regional Development Act of 1965 by establishing an Interagency Coordinating Council on Appalachia and adding a section on telecommunications and technology. The Appalachian Regional Development Reauthorization Act of 2001 establishes the Commission to provide technical assistance, grants, and funds for increasing access to advanced telecommunications, education and training, technology readiness programs, and entrepreneurial opportunities in the region. The Appalachian Regional Development Reauthorization Act of 2001 establishes the Commission to provide assistance from appropriations or other sources, increase Federal share limitations, and authorize appropriations of $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2002. SEC. 4. PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT CRITERIA.

(a) Growth Center Criteria Elimination: Amends Section 224(a)(1) to remove the requirement for significant growth potential in designated areas.

(b) Assistance to Distressed Counties: Adds a new section to allocate at least half of grant expenditures to benefit severely distressed counties or areas.

SEC. 5. GRANTS FOR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES OF LOCAL DEVELOPMENT DISTRICTS.

Amends Section 302(a)(1)(A) to increase the Federal share to 75 percent for development districts including distressed counties. SEC. 6. Addition of counties to Appalachian region: Amends Section 403 to add counties in Kentucky and Mississippi. SEC. 7. Technical amendments. The Act (40 U.S.C. App.) is amended to change references from "implementing investment program" to "strategy statement" in various sections, including section 101(b), section 225, and section 303. This includes updating references to Appalachian State development programs to Appalachian State development strategies. The Act (40 U.S.C. App.) is further amended to support Local Development Districts, modify Office Space Leasing terms, and define Federal Grant-In-Aid Programs. The Act defines Federal grant-in-aid programs for land acquisition, development, facility construction, and community/economic development activities authorized by specific Acts. The Act outlines various Federal grant-in-aid programs authorized by specific Acts, excluding programs related to highway or road construction. The Act excludes highway or road construction programs from Federal grant-in-aid programs authorized by specific Acts. It also amends program development criteria by replacing "per capita income" with "per capita market income." SEC. 8. Authorization of appropriations for the Appalachian development highway system program: $78,000,000 for fiscal year 2002, $80,000,000 for fiscal year 2003, $83,000,000 for fiscal year 2004, $85,000,000 for fiscal year 2005, and $87,000,000 for fiscal year 2006. SEC. 9. Termination extended to 2006.
